question:
Let $\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix}.$  Compute
\[\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb.\]
answer:
Note that
\[\mathbf{A}^2 = \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 \end{pmatrix} = \mathbf{0}.\]Therefore, $\mathbf{A}^n = \mathbf{0}$ for all $n \ge 2,$ which means
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb &= \mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix} + 2 \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 31 & 50 \\ -18 & -29 \end{pmatrix}}.
\end{align*}
agents_response:
We observe that
\begin{align*}
\mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb &= \mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A} \mathbf{A} + 4 \mathbf{A} \mathbf{A}^2 + \dotsb \\
&= \mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{A}^2 + 4 \mathbf{A}^3 + \dotsb \\
&= \mathbf{I} + 2 \mathbf{A} + 3 \mathbf{I} + 4 \mathbf{A} + \dotsb \\
&= (1 + 3 + \dotsb) \mathbf{I} + (2 + 4 + \dotsb) \mathbf{A} \\
&= \frac{1}{1 - 3} \mathbf{I} + \frac{2}{1 - 2} \mathbf{A} \\
&= -\frac{1}{2} \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix} + 2 \begin{pmatrix} 15 & 25 \\ -9 & -15 \end{pmatrix} \\
&= \begin{pmatrix} 14 & 25 \\ -9 & -13 \end{pmatrix}.
\end{align*}Therefore, the answer is $\boxed{\begin{pmatrix} 14 & 25 \\ -9 & -13 \end{pmatrix}}$.
